pull.title: chainparams: Re-add seed.bitcoinstats.com
pull.body:
Following the removal in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30720, `seed.bitcoinstats.com` has been rebuilt from scratch and has been working correctly for the last couple of weeks. If desired we can re-enable it in the list of available seeds.

This reverts commit c88a7dc53e3be7489605c3326cf768df5437393a.

events.message:
chainparams: Re-add seed.bitcoinstats.com

Following the removal seed.bitcoinstats.com has been rebuilt from
scratch and has been working correctly for the last couple of
weeks. If desired we can re-enable it in the list of available
seeds.

This reverts commit c88a7dc53e3be7489605c3326cf768df5437393a.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/31086.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.

It  currently doesn't give me any results for `x9`, IIRC the most common filter:
```
host x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com.
```

> No IPv6 support?

I might add ipv6 support, but still fighting with my cloud provider about that.

> It  currently doesn't give me any results for `x9`, IIRC the most common filter:
> ```
> host x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com.
> ```

Interesting, I'll check why that is.

From what I can tell it is working as expected:

```
dig x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. @1.1.1.1

; <<>> DiG 9.18.28-0ubuntu0.22.04.1-Ubuntu <<>> x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. @1.1.1.1
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 28948
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 24, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version: 0, flags:; udp: 1232
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com.      IN      A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       203.11.72.158
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       34.65.71.81
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       152.42.139.133
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       203.11.72.190
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       24.16.252.126
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       193.86.97.61
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       169.155.170.211
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       34.92.205.223
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       203.11.72.34
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       71.197.212.98
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       95.217.87.60
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       99.79.135.85
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       35.224.86.8
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       203.11.72.10
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       203.11.72.43
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       80.104.101.172
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       178.18.248.27
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       23.175.0.202
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       35.204.137.151
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       203.11.72.77
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       86.121.167.231
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       34.82.128.79
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       49.12.83.18
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 3600  IN      A       177.53.242.47

;; Query time: 34 msec
;; SERVER: 1.1.1.1#53(1.1.1.1) (UDP)
;; WHEN: Mon Oct 21 10:41:18 CEST 2024
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 437
```

> From what I can tell it is working as expected:

Yes. When using `@1.1.1.1` it works. Without, i get the following. Apparently my ISP's DNS server (or the router's) is behaving funny.
```
; <<>> DiG 9.18.28-0ubuntu0.24.04.1-Ubuntu <<>> x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com.
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 30929
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 1, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version: 0, flags:; udp: 65494
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com.      IN      A

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
x9.seed.bitcoinstats.com. 8393  IN      SOA     seedns.bitcoinstats.com. mail.bitcoinstats.com. 1729471189 604800 86400 2592000 604800

;; Query time: 1 msec
;; SERVER: 127.0.0.53#53(127.0.0.53) (UDP)
;; WHEN: Mon Oct 21 11:26:36 CEST 2024
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 101
```
Oh, that's a good data point. Seems the result is larger than your ISP is willing to forward. Would you like me to return fewer results?

> Oh, that's a good data point. Seems the result is larger than your ISP is willing to forward. Would you like me to return fewer results?

The number of results (24-25)  is not that different from the other DNS seeds. i don't think the problem is with that.

i tried specifying the ISP's DNS server IP directly with `dig` and this worked, and suddenly it's just working also without. Maybe it's just something dumb with the local configuration. Let's wait if other people stumble on problems first.

>It currently doesn't give me any results for x9, IIRC the most common filter:

Same here

<!--8ac04cdde196e94527acabf64b896448-->
There hasn't been much activity lately. What is the status here?

[Finding reviewers](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#finding-reviewers) may take time. However, if the patch is no longer relevant, please close this pull request. If the author lost interest or time to work on this, please close it and mark it 'Up for grabs' with the label, so that it can be picked up in the future.
Doesn't seem this should be closed, would just be nice to have some more testing.
